revised_title: Spectrum Analysis of the Great Nebula in the Sword-Handle of Orion
tldr: William Huggins examines the spectrum of the Great Nebula in the Sword-Handle of Orion and discovers that the light from different parts of the nebula is identical in character, indicating that the bright portions consisting of closely aggregated stars do not have a continuous spectrum. This challenges the previously accepted belief that the resolution of a nebula into bright stellar points is a certain indication of discrete stars.
